FuncDef:
The user-aging command sets the aging period of a local user account.
The undo user-aging command restores the default setting.
By default, a local user account does not age.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the aging period.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 365, in days.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To age a local user account that has been idle for a long time, run the user-aging command. If a user account keeps being idle for a configured aging period, the user account automatically ages.
Configuration Impact
After the configured aging period elapses, users using the local user account fail to log in.
